title: Collaborative Microlearning Design for Preparing General Education Mathematics Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Collaborative lesson design for adapting general education math curricula. Blended learning environment linking preteaching by special education experts with mainstream classroom instruction

learning_goals: Learners can explain core concepts of a general educational mathematics curriculum (statistics, calculus, linear algebra, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.
Learners complete collaborative problem-solving tasks (twice weekly) on a mobile microlearning platform with over 90% completion and develop self-directed learning habits.
Learners apply mathematical and collaborative skills (problem analysis, logical explanation, peer feedback) acquired during preteaching with over 75% frequency during regular classes.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
